page.title: 17Then & Now- life in 1925 (5)
page.content: We had a blacklead stove. What she mostly used to cook would be a rabbit stew; my husband then my young man would bring her over a couple of rabbits, a sheep's head & perhaps a breast of lamb- no best joint in our day- you couldn't afford it. {Where did your water come from?} We used to go down to the street- I expect you've seen the rest of the tap there. We used to go up by Mrs Tidball's and collect from there with buckets. {How did you keep food fresh?} We'd have a safe, that is a little wooden box with wire netting and if we had anything where we needed to keep the flies off we'd pop it in there- no fridges or anything.
